definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The indomitable spirit of man also cant help tears.
sentences.chinese: 这个顶天立地的男人也不禁泪如雨下。

sentences.english: ''We thought she was dead,'' the aunt said through a shower of tears.
sentences.chinese: “我们以为她死了，”婶母说着，泪如雨下。

sentences.english: See suicide after poor Du Shan, xiao-feng liu love of tears.
sentences.chinese: 看到自杀后可怜的杜山，刘小凤心疼的泪如雨下。

sentences.english: This year the fall, but I think the departure of their loved ones burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 这一年秋天，我想起亲人的离去却泪如雨下。

sentences.english: Rose looks up at Jack tears pouring down her face.
sentences.chinese: 露丝抬头望着杰克，泪如雨下。

sentences.english: When tears come down like falling rain, you'll toss around and call my name.
sentences.chinese: 当泪如雨下，你将辗转反侧呼唤我的名字。

sentences.english: So he held his mother, and she clung to him, and she shed many tears.
sentences.chinese: 于是他搂着母亲，母亲靠在他身上，泪如雨下。

sentences.english: My teardrops fell like rain that day.
I still felt unsure if I would be able to without breaking down into tears.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然不确定我是否能够控制住不泪如雨下。

sentences.english: She burst into tears as she knew her son got a heart donor.
sentences.chinese: 当她得知有心脏捐赠者捐心给儿子时，立刻泪如雨下。

sentences.english: The mourner's profuse tears at the burial were heartbreaking.
sentences.chinese: 送葬者泪如雨下，令人心碎。

sentences.english: If has artificial me to weep copiously .
sentences.chinese: 如果有人为我泪如雨下。

sentences.english: Li Mu sees a daughter accordingly, tears such as rain afterward.
sentences.chinese: 李母见女儿如此，泪如雨下。

sentences.english: When her mother looks at her, Tingting ­suddenly bursts into tears.
sentences.chinese: 当妈妈看着女儿时，婷婷忽然泪如雨下。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
to feel a pain like a knife being twisted in one's heart (idiom)
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
to feel as if having one's heart cut out (idiom)/to be torn with grief
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
